response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age", "high", "At 20 years old, youth is associated with a higher risk of recidivism due to lesser maturity and impulse control."],
    ["Race", "low", "Being White does not statistically increase recidivism risk compared to other racial groups."],
    ["Criminal History", "medium", "One arrest with no conviction presents some risk, though the absence of a conviction mitigates it somewhat."],
    ["Substance Use", "high", "Recent use of marijuana and cocaine significantly increases risk due to associations with substance-related behavior."],
    ["Employment Stability", "high", "Holding four jobs in one year indicates employment instability, which is linked to higher recidivism risk."],
    ["Education", "medium", "Having only a GED and not pursuing college suggests lower educational attainment, which is moderately associated with recidivism."],
    ["Living Arrangements", "low", "Not living alone can provide a structured social environment that reduces recidivism risk."],
    ["Marital Status", "low", "Never having been married is not a strong indicator of recidivism risk by itself."],
    ["Mental Health", "low", "Not feeling depressed suggests stable mental health, which lowers recidivism risk."],
    ["Family/Neighborhood Background", "medium", "Growing up in a larger household in an urban area can correlate with higher exposure to risk factors."],
    ["Religious Belief", "medium", "A lack of belief in a higher power may reduce community and moral support, moderately increasing recidivism risk."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: At 20 years old, youth is associated with a higher risk of recidivism due to lesser maturity and impulse control.
Being White does not statistically increase recidivism risk compared to other racial groups.
One arrest with no conviction presents some risk, though the absence of a conviction mitigates it somewhat.
Recent use of marijuana and cocaine significantly increases risk due to associations with substance-related behavior.
Holding four jobs in one year indicates employment instability, which is linked to higher recidivism risk.
Having only a GED and not pursuing college suggests lower educational attainment, which is moderately associated with recidivism.
Not living alone can provide a structured social environment that reduces recidivism risk.
Never having been married is not a strong indicator of recidivism risk by itself.
Not feeling depressed suggests stable mental health, which lowers recidivism risk.
Growing up in a larger household in an urban area can correlate with higher exposure to risk factors.
A lack of belief in a higher power may reduce community and moral support, moderately increasing recidivism risk.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 20-year-old male who identifies himself as White. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 6 feet 0 inches and weighs 204 lbs. He has never been married and is currently not living alone. He has a GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held 4 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana and cocaine) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 6, in an urban area. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
